ProjectCodeCombine module¶

File Description:¶

This file contains data cleaning and visualization. It contains functions that reduce original data file to contain only relevant information such as FIPS and Food Insecurity rate, visualize Food Insecurity rate and cost per meal countrywide, visualizes how household type and race impact Food Insecurity rate, and more. Also, we implemented a pipeline that selects the same factors from multiple files, which allows efficient analysis of annual changes.

ProjectCodeCombine.draw_FIrate()¶

This function reads data from the data/MMG{year0}_{year1}Data_ToShare.xlsx files, and only take the “FIPS” and “{year} Food Insecurity Rate” columns. It then adjust column name to “Rate of Food Insecurity” so it is suitable for later use.

Returns

pd.DataFrame: A pd.DataFrame that contains that year’s information of FIPS and Rate of Food Insecurity.

ProjectCodeCombine.prepare_data()¶

This function will prepare the data in the following 5 categories: 1. FI: overall food insecurity(fi) rate 2. FI_Density: density of food insecure people 3. Child_FI: child fi rate 4. Budget: budget shortfall 5. FI_Change: fi changes in recent 2 years

return: county FIPS, name and data above return type: pd.DataFrame

ProjectCodeCombine.rank_county(df)¶

This function will rank the counties’ food insecurity degree based on the 5 factors. A higher ranking score indicates the county has more severe food insecurity issues. :param df: dataframe returned from prepared_data :type: pd.DataFrame :return: prepared data with ranking data :return type: pd.DataFrame

ProjectCodeCombine.result_visual(df)¶

This function will visualize the result, a choropleth map, using the ranking data. :param df: dataframe returned from rank_county :return: none

ProjectCodeCombine.visualization_food_cost_map(data)¶

This function generates a interactable visuals of the cost per meal data countrywide.

Args

data (pd.DataFrame): data with columns of “FIPS” and “2009 Cost Per Meal”

Returns

go.Figure: The interatable visuals of food price in 2009.

ProjectCodeCombine.visualization_food_insecurity_map(df)¶

This funciton visualize the data that we cleaned in draw_FIrate, to a US interactable map that is specified to county level, indicating Food Insecurity Rate of each county.

Args

df (pd.DataFrame): the data that we cleaned in draw_FIrate, contains that year’s information of FIPS and Rate of Food Insecurity

Returns

go.Figure: the go.Figure of the visualization of a US interactable map.

ProjectCodeCombine.visualization_food_insecurity_plot(data)¶

This function generates bar plot of food inseterity rates in different states.

Args

data (pd.DataFrame): This is the data of the past_trend of Food Insecurity, containing information of states and food insecurity.

Returns

go.Figure: Bar plot of food inseterity rates in different states.

ProjectCodeCombine.visualization_food_insecurity_race(data)¶

This function generates bar plot of Food Insecurity vs race.

Args

data (_type_): This data is from the data_race file, with information of food insecurity rate and race.

ProjectCodeCombine.visualization_household(snap)¶

This function generates visualization of Food Insecurity Rate vc household.

Args

snap (pd.DataFrame): This data contains information of Food Insecurity Rate and types of house holds, such as With elders or not or Number of Workers.

Returns

go.Figure: A figure of Food Insecurity Rate vc household.
